channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath blocked with overhanging branches - along Council Estate Flats 17 to 79, 16th July
item.description:
Several gardens from Ground Floor Flats at Council Estate Flats 17 to 79 have overground vegetation encroaching the pavement. Camden Council should either request neighbours to trim regularly or do the trim and issue penalties for encroaching public footpaths. (Unable to attach photos - happy to email separately).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mansfield Road, Gospel Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Recent flytipping by our neighbour, 16th July

item.title: Timplates removed from lamposts causing untold builders parking, 16th July
item.description:
The parking timplates have been removed from all lampposts on Nelson Mandela Road SE3 9QS, causing untold amount of vehicles parking
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nelson Mandela Road, Kidbrooke, London

item.title: Footpath between Pedestrian Crossing & opposite Kingsford Street, 16th July
item.description:
Several gardens from Ground Floor Flats at Wendling Estate 181 to 214 blocks have overground vegetation encroaching the already narrow pavement - this section is already congested with a bus shelter, a tree and handrail to protect from cycle lane. Camden Council should either request neighbours to trim regularly or do the trim and issue penalties for encroaching public footpaths. (Unable to attach photos - happy to email separately).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southampton Road, Gospel Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown nettles overhanging footpath., 16th July
item.description:
For many months the path has been overgrown with nettles coming out of the fences onto the path. It's a heavily congested path with 3 schools using it to access to and from the school. It's quite narrow already and my children and I have been stung by the nettles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnfield Wood Road, Park Langley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Box of earth and builders rubble, 16th July
item.description:
This box has been here for almost a MONTH. It is now attracting more fly tipped rubbish and waste piling up around it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 111-123, Manor Place, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are dead trees on the streets, 16th July
item.description:
There are dead trees on the streets, please come and inspect before they fall and cause the severe dammages. thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rodway Road, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bikes dumped on the Andover Estate, 16th July
item.description:
Numerous Lime bikes dumped on the Andover Estate as a result of easily being unlocked and very young children riding them and them dumping them when they have to go inside. A daily occurrence. Lime bikes are literally littered everywhere, every day

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Andover Road, Finsbury Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Kimmeridge Road, Mottingham, London

item.title: Large wasps nest in tree, 16th July
item.description:
There is a large wasps nest in one of the trees in Hall Place Football Ground. As you come in the gate next to the car garage, if you go straight on, along the side, it's just a few trees up. Lots of children play football here and there were many wasps going in and out.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bourne Road, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Several wooden panels dumped
